“Tuff biscuits, kitty. Consider this the start of your punishment” The wolf replied with a nasty grin, and grabbed some fruit from the bag.

The desperate cat thrashed around for a bit, but in the end he had no choice and with a loud gulp the food went down.

“They ya go, that wasn’t so hard, cry-baby.” Herc teased in a biting tone, “Now let’s have the second!”

Herc was about to shove the other strongfat fruit down his gullet, when suddenly a LOUD gurgle rumbled from the cat’s stomach.

It was loud enough to startle the wolf, and he quickly jumped off of the cat, who’s expression was a mix between emotionless, half-lidded eyes, and looking like he was about to puke.

Then he started growing, just a tiny bit, like the men who ate the fruit normally grew. And it then it stopped.

The group let out a sigh of relief, for a second there it looked like something horrible was about to happen.

And then a second later something horrible happened.

Jang started swelling again like before, but he wouldn’t slow down. The air was filled with the sound of a cat howling, burping, and a few hiccups. He tried to speak but he was simply incomprehensible.

The group took a few cautious steps backwards, half unsure if he was going to explode!

Luckily, for Jang, he didn’t. His poor stretched dome of a belly just kept expanding, quite soon literally pushing the trees that lined the path to bend. He was firmly wedge in there, globular black butt (with the hint very fat tail poking out) exposed to the bandits. Huge belly blocking their path, still slowly oozing out in every direction.

“Herc you IDIOT!” Perralace yelled, punching the dumbstruck wolf in the back of the head.

“Ack!” though not really hurt, “What the hell? I didn’t expect that to happen? Why the hell did that happen??”

“It doesn’t matter you shouldn’t have forced him to eat when he was like that!” she yelled back.

The wolf huffed, and then rolled his eyes, “I was half considering cutting him in half for being a rotting traitor, would you have preferred that? My Queen?”

Perralace glared daggers into Herc, who then turned his attention to Loagi.

“Hey bear, I thought you said this fruit was safe?!”

The tubby bear shrunk down into his robe, he didn’t want Herc’s wrath, “Uhh, well… I think it is, it just must have… must have had a bad reaction to the poison that’s inside him.

Look, you can hear the cat is alive and well…” He was cut off by a thunderous burp, “maybe a little gassy…. But by all rights he SHOULD be dead at this size”

Bart the tiger cut in, “…You’re sure that it’s reacting to the fruit, I don’t want to blow up like that if I eat another of these”

“I’m…” the bear looked a little apprehensive, “I’m sure. But, if we’re still planning to go for the antidote… right?”

Herc looked ambivalent, “…yeah, I feel it’d be good to investigate this little village cat-blob was talking about, they’re probably hiding treasure there, and the way to Sarcous!... Aaand this path is blocked anyway”

“Well, while you plan to investigate the village, I think it’d be wise if anyone here who has eaten the fruit stay at the fork in the road. As we’d be especially vulnerable to becoming like poor Jang.”

“What?! But that would only leave me and Perralce to face the village, you slackers!” Herc yelled indignant.

“And bunny boy” the jaguar said motioning to Crom. With all eyes on him, suddenly Crom really felt stupid for not partaking in the fruit.

“Like hell Crom is going anywhere without me!” Rubin spoke up. Crom motioned from him to quiet down, he didn’t need both of them putting their neck on the line for no good reason. But the roo wouldn’t hear it, and they immediately got into a little squabble about who would stay and who would go in front of everybody.

Though all the attention was stolen by Maxwell, the classy coyote speaking up, “And I shall attend this village, perhaps they have a chief with whom I can negotiate. If not, if they can’t be reasoned with, well I expect my wizards and your gang of barbarians, no matter how small, should be able to easily take of them, they were the mere size of large rodents afterall”

“B-but you’ve seen how they annihilated the rest of out gang!” Loagi cried out exasperated.

Herc glared daggers at the bear, and motioned to strike him before being stopped by the coyote”

“A-heh, no cousin, let him speak to me, just this once. I am beyond reasonable if nothing else.

Battle is all about strategy, my plump, herb mixing simpleton.” The bear jostled at such overt rudeness, but didn’t dare step out of line, “To win battle is all about strategy, and surprise. Even a village full of rats can win against the mightiest foe with such tools. The fool Rex didn’t know what he was getting into, but we shall come prepared, so we have the advantage.”

The coyote smirked, full of confidence that only years of experience backstabbing and lying could build.

“Gentlemen, lets make haste, we’re wasting precious sunlight.”

“But what about Jang?!” Bart protested, the cat boy had finally seemed to stop growing, but it hard to tell, his belly was basically just a big black boulder blocking the path.

“Erg, was that an invitation for all of the –help- to speak to me? We’re leaving him, that should be obvious.”

“You heartless –“ Bart was quickly shut up by Herc putting a hand over his mouth. “Shut it! No, the commissioner is correct, it’s not even possible to do anything for Jang now, we’ve got a deadline, so lets now dwell on it. We’re going, and that’s final!” He said sternly to the group.

Everyone begrudgingly accepted, except for Crom and Rubin who were still too caught up in their tiff. Rubin eventually prevailed in that he would come if Crom was forced to, damn the risks.

info.description:
Backstory


Thousands of years ago, back in a day and age where kings did not rule and nations did not matter, lived a sorcerer that delved into magic too powerful to comprehend or to name in mortal tongues. A magic that may have even created the universe, a magic that Gods possessed. However he tapped too far and fell in too deep. He discovered the hard way that normal mortal bodies are nearly destroyed when exposed to the magic for seconds, to counter this he discovered a solution to ready his body.

Suddenly this sorcerer, who called himself "Sarcous" disappeared from the world. All that was left of him was a message and a pendant. Discovered by his fellow magicians. One cryptic hint was left behind. "The eye will lead you to the orb."

As years passed, the pendant was lost to the sands of time and Sarcous' discovery was forever hidden. Until rumors of Sarcous' "eye" being found caught wind and were spread to daring adventurers ready to make the power their own. Unbeknownst to them that they will be changed forever.

Ground Rules


1. Plot without porn! Keep the sexual content to a minimum, while I do not mind romance I don't want this to go into an all out porn.

2. Use your imagination. Flesh out the weight gain of this story, terrible pun definitely intended. It's a major plot point that the characters need to get bigger so have some fun with it, rather than have them reach whale-like proportions within two chapters.

3. I'm not by any means a grammar nazi, but if your chapter is an incomprehensible mess then I'm afraid I can't keep it around. Also I would like to keep submissions in prose format. Script format will be frowned upon in my interactive and is strongly discouraged.

With all that said time to join the adventure...
